column5: Well I went to buy a sled and ended up with a broken leg. Out of commission for at least 12 weeks with this one. Broke both the fibula and tibia bones in my right leg. Titanium plates and screws to hold it together. I tell I have that image burned in my head of my leg being bent over the way you don't won't to see it  , extremely painfull. On 2 perks every 3 hours to kill the pain   and watching lots of movies and fishing shows.  So show me the pictures of the fish you get and make sure you guys play it say out there!!   Rob C
ouch!!! i don't know what would hurt more - the leg or no ice fishing! seriously though, that really sucks how'd ya do it if you don't mind me asking?
Dude... that sucks!!!! Rob here's to hopeing for a speedy recovery!!  wishing you all the best!  Gerritt.
How in the heck to you go to buy a sled and end up with a broken leg?   Don't tell me you were grabassin' around on it.
That's tough luck Rob and sorry to hear your bad news  Hope everything turns out good for you.
Eeee doggies, that's a fetch a pain yer a settin' on. I've been holdin' up granny from tryin' ta practise her doctor skills on ya.
That really bites Rob C, I hope you have a speedy recovery.  HF

Well I didn't even buy the sled I was going to look at it and I will have the tell you the rest of the story at a later date as there is lawyer now involved. So you know the routine from them. I am still looking to get a sled but I will have till next year to ride it
Ouuuuuuuuuuuuuch, hope it heals fast just in time for spring fishing.
man that sucks!  Wish you a speedy recovery!  Cheers!
Best wishes bud...but a broken leg would not stop me from fishing...lol.  I would find a way!

Wow now that sucks.  But i have one question?  You said they put plates  and screws in your leg, so your good to go, drop 3 perks in a cup of coffee and enjoy the day,  dont let a little pain spoil your fishing................lol  I was on those a month ago, they are great untill your body gets use to them, then look out, wish you the best
man speedy recovery to you... better now then on bass opener!
Wish you a speedy recovery dude.  Sounds very painful.
sucks but look on the bright side, youre probably not going to miss much
Oh man...tib and fib!  Hoping you have a speedy recovery.
My son went through one of those ordeals, nuts and bolts, etc, just keep an eye on it, if there's any sign of infection, see the Doc, right away.  His oozed, pussed and bled for a long time.

wow thats gotta suck...ive been lucky and ive only broken fingers before.  sounds like you slipped on the ice on the sidewalk at the place where you were gonna buy a sled. take them for as much as you can if thats the case  im sure someone can throw you on a sled and pull you out on the ice...  OR  get someone to rig up a wheelchair that goes on skis
That was the deposit on the sled. Those damn things cost an arm and.....

I wish you a fast recovery so you can get back to  I don't know what will be worse? The broken leg or having to deal woth our legal system. One is probably just as painful as the other.  Good luck with both.
